list-item.label: a)
list-item.p: Where possible, the engine shall be disengaged from the transmission in the brake test and, where this is not possible, the highest gear consistent with the test speed shall be selected.

list-item.label: b)
list-item.p: In cases where a hydrostatic transmission braking system is used, the transmission circuit shall be bypassed when testing the secondary brake system.

list-item.label: c)
list-item.p: The test speed shall be the maximum achievable speed on a level surface.

list-item.label: d)
list-item.p: The test course shall consist of a hard, dry surface with a well compacted base. Ground moisture may be present to the extent that it does not adversely affect the braking test.

list-item.label: e)
list-item.p: The test course shall not have a slope of more than 3Â % in the direction of travel.

list-item.label: f)
list-item.p: The test shall be performed with maximum rig mass and under moving conditions as specified by the manufacturer.

list-item.label: g)
list-item.p: All parameters relating to the brake system, e.g. tyre size, brake adjustment and pressures in the brake system, etc. shall be as specified by the manufacturer of the rig. No manual adjustments shall be made to the braking system during any single performance test.

list-item.label: h)
list-item.p: All brake tests shall be performed with burnished (conditioned) brakes. The burnishing procedure shall be checked by consulting the brake manufacturer.

list-item.label: i)
list-item.p: Immediately prior to a test, the rig shall be operated until the fluids, e.g. engine and transmission oils, are at normal temperature.
